## Welcome to MSDA Bootcamp

Our bootcamp covers three areas of knowledge essential for data analytics in social sciences
  1. Mathematical foundations for data analytics, including Calculus and Linear Algebra
  2. R (and R Studio) for data visualizaton and data wrangling
  3. Probability and Statistics

## Schedule

```{r}
library(tidyverse)
library(lubridate)
library(knitr)
library(kableExtra)

# Define the schedule data

schedule <- tibble(
  Date = c("2025-08-26", "2025-08-26", "2025-08-27", "2025-08-28", "2025-08-29",
           "2025-08-29"),
  Time = c("09:00 - 12:00", "14:00 - 17:00", "14:00 - 17:00",
           "14:00 - 17:00", "09:00 - 12:00", "14:00 - 17:00"),
  Topic = c("Overview and Review of Calculus",
            "Review of Linear Algebra",
            "Introduction to R (and RStudio)",
            "Data Visualization with ggplot2",
            "Data Wrangling with tidyverse",
            "Elements of Probability and Statistics")
)

# Convert Date to a more readable format
schedule <- schedule %>%
  mutate(Date = format(as.Date(Date), "%B %d, %Y"))

# Create the table

# kable(schedule, format = "html", table.attr = "class='table table-striped'",
#       col.names = c("Date", "Time", "Topic")) %>%
#   kable_styling(full_width = F, position = "left") %>% 
#   column_spec(column = 3, width = "50%")
  
# Create a basic HTML table
kable(schedule, format = "html", col.names = c("Date", "Time", "Topic"), align = "l")

```
